page.title: 01GURNARD.
page.content: Gurnard is a small village on the outskirts of Cowes.It is a very peaceful place and much quieter than Cowes.It is on the north side of the Island facing the Mainland.There is not much traffic and big lorries hardly ever come through the village. The main road is called Worsley Road and there are three roads leading off it.In the village there is one post office and six or seven shops and quite a lot of Victorian houses, because Gurnard is a Victorian village.There are many more houses than shops.It is a very friendly place to live,because everyone knows everyone which is nice.Lots of retired people live in Gurnard. The oldest one is a lady of 104.There is a church and a primary school in Gurnard.
